result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas N. Hurdle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --To pay fine of costs and DNA surcharge= $443.  The payment plan in Case #15CT558 also applies to this case; non-payment on this amount will result in 10 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive

--To serve 180 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith, concurrent with the jail term in Case #15CT558

--the Court allows for the transfer of the service of this jail term to the Waukesha County Jail conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring for service of the jail term 

--Mr. Hurdle is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served,with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process

--To provide DNA sample upon demand
Concurrent with: Jail term in 15CT558

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas N. Hurdle

records.addlTxt: Accounts receivable payment history mailed to defendant - Returned with COA from UMS. (fwd to updated address on 12/13/19)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: COC's Response to Inmate Request Form received on 4-1-2016

[MK] cases #15CT558 and #16CM110 called at 9:31am.
Defendant Nicholas N. Hurdle in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Initial Appearance held in Case #16CM110:  Service of the Complaint admitted; reading waived. 
The Court requires Mr. Hurdle to report to the Sheriff's Department for booking on Case #16CM110 today. 
Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Case #15CT558- Count #1 and on Case #16CM110-Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Hall submits a victim restitution form); the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Hurdle guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #15CT558-Counts #2& #3.

On Case #15CT558-Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Hurdle: 

--To serve 180 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith, consecutive to any previously imposed sentence 
--the Court allows for the transfer of the service of this jail term to the Waukesha County Jail conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring for service of the jail term
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
--Mr. Hurdle is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served,with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
--To pay fine of $500 + costs to be paid in $50 per month installments, commencing on 4/30/16 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 30 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--Revocation of drivers license for 18 months
--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 18 month period

--6 demerit points assessed
--to provide DNA sample upon demand 
In Case #15CT558, the Court orders entry of a civil judgment for restitution in favor of Joseph W. Kopiness, in the amount of $500.


On Case #16CM110, the Court sentences Mr. Hurdle: 
--To serve 180 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith, concurrent with the jail term in Case #15CT558
--the Court allows for the transfer of the service of this jail term to the Waukesha County Jail conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring for service of the jail term 
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
--Mr. Hurdle is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served,with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
--To pay fine of costs and DNA surcharge= $443.  The payment plan in Case #15CT558 also applies to this case; non-payment on this amount will result in 10 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--To provide DNA sample upon demand 
[Clerk's added notes:  the DNA sample form was provided to the Defense post-hearing, however a carbon copy of the signed form was not returned to the clerk; further note-- the clerk failed to give the Defendant a time-to-pay slip and installment plan policy information in court, so one should be mailed to Mr. Hurdle please.]
recess 9:53am
